channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland

item.title: Covid-19: NI medics warn of more cancelled operations
item.description: Health staff say further cancellations are inevitable due to hospital pressure from unvaccinated patients.

item.title: Dungannon: Mother charged over child's death 'lied to police'
item.description: Jade Dempsey, who is accused of causing her two-year-old's death, appears at a bail hearing.

item.title: Ballymurphy: Shadow SoS meets victims' families in Belfast
item.description: Ms Haigh says people across the UK are "unanimous" in their opposition to Troubles legacy proposals.

item.title: Mark Sheridan, 25, urged to hand himself in to police
item.description: Mark Sheridan, 25, who was convicted for assault, cannot be located after being recalled to prison.

item.title: Covid-19: Four more deaths and 1,389 new cases
item.description: Covid-19 linked deaths are reported by counting patients who die within 28 days of testing positive.

item.title: Fishing in Fermanagh: Reeling in young anglers by teaching new skills
item.description: Erne Anglers is offering lessons in the basics of fishing to youngsters in Enniskillen.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: GCSEs: Rise in top grades in Northern Ireland as results issued
item.description: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, pupils' results were based on grades calculated by schools.

item.title: Covid-19: Where are Covid-19 vaccine clinics in NI?
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records 31 virus-related deaths in NI
item.description: Thirty-one deaths were registered in the week up to last Friday, a rise of 13 from the previous week.

item.title: Covid-19: Universities to return to face-to-face teaching
item.description: The majority of students in Northern Ireland have spent the last academic year learning online.

item.title: Covid-19: Unvaccinated dad speaks of four-day ventilator ordeal
item.description: Gerald Prentice, who spent four days on a ventilator, says he has "no doubt" a jab would have helped.

item.title: Covid-19: Three more deaths and 1,610 new cases
item.description: Covid-19 linked deaths are reported by counting patients who die within 28 days of testing positive.

item.title: Covid-19: NI student struggling to get vaccination certificate
item.description: Conor Kernohan cannot get a vaccine certificate as he got one jab in GB and the second in Belfast.

item.title: Covid-19: Education minister wants end to masks in class
item.description: The Northern Ireland Executive is expected to discuss face coverings and class bubbles on Thursday.

item.title: The Northern Ireland couple who took on the world in a camper van
item.description: In 1971, a couple left the violence in Belfast to travel around the world in a camper van.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: GCSE results 2021: The lowdown on the exams in NI
item.description: A potted guide to GCSE exams, which did not take place for the second year in a row due to Covid-19.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup final in Belfast: In pictures
item.description: Chelsea will take on Villareal at Windsor Park in the first Uefa club final held in Belfast.

item.title: Eniola Aluko: Ex-footballer calls for end to online abuse
item.description: Former England footballer Eniola Aluko deleted her Twitter account after receiving racist abuse.

item.title: Q&A: A-level results day in Northern Ireland
item.description: The lowdown on A-levels in Northern Ireland as pupils receive their results on Tuesday.

item.title: GCSE results: 'I'm excited for the next step'
item.description: Students across Northern Ireland received their GCSE results on Thursday.

item.title: Covid-19: 'The justification for regulations is diminishing'
item.description: First Minister Paul Givan says he hopes all restrictions will be lifted by the end of next month.

item.title: Covid-19: Michelle O'Neill says executive is taking 'a cautious approach'
item.description: Michelle O'Neill says the executive is "taking a cautious approach" to easing Covid-19 restrictions.

item.title: Uefa Super Cup: Fans arrive in Belfast ahead of Chelsea vs. Villareal game
item.description: Football fans have been arriving in Belafst ahead of Wednesday's Uefa Super Cup Final at Windsor Park.

item.title: Londonderry: NSPCC reverses plan to cut face-to-face services
item.description: The planned closure of services in Craigavon, County Armagh, will still go ahead, the charity says.

item.title: Covid-19: Derry man out on bail after refusing hotel quarantine
item.description: The 32-year-old faces a fine of up to £10,000 if convicted of breaching Covid-19 rules

item.title: Apprentice Boys Relief of Derry parade scaled back for second year
item.description: The annual parade marks the anniversary of the ending of the Siege of Derry in August 1689.

item.title: Londonderry: Elemental Software bought for undisclosed sum
item.description: The software firm was set up by former community development workers and employs more than 30 people.

item.title: Limerick: Pair held on suspicion of boy's murder freed
item.description: The four-year-old child was fatally injured in a house in Limerick on 13 March.

item.title: Gerry Hutch arrested in Spain over boxing weigh-in gun attack
item.description: Gerry Hutch, known as "The Monk", is wanted over the 2016 gun attack at the Regency Airport Hotel.

item.title: Climate change: Ireland getting warmer and wetter
item.description: The Status of Ireland Climate 2020 report also shows that sea levels around the coast are rising.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 50,000 12-15s register for vaccine
item.description: Health chiefs say about 42,000 children were signed up within hours of the registration opening

item.title: Kathy Hochul: New York's next governor influenced by Irish roots
item.description: Kathy Hochul's grandparents were from Ireland and had a "profound impact" on her political outlook.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccines for Irish 12 to 15-year-olds start this weekend
item.description: Health chiefs expect a strong uptake when registrations for the age group open on Thursday.
